inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Path to solution, packages.config, or project.json
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to solution, packages.config, or project.json file

inputs.name: selectOrConfig
inputs.label: Feeds (package sources) to use
inputs.helpMarkDown: To select one feed from VSTS and/or NuGet.org select them here. For multiple feeds, commit a nuget.config file to your source code repository and set its path here.

inputs.name: feed
inputs.label: Include packages from this VSTS feed

inputs.name: nugetConfigPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.config
inputs.helpMarkDown: Equivalent to the -ConfigFile NuGet.exe command line argument

inputs.name: restoreMode
inputs.label: Installation type
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Restore will restore the packages a solution depends upon, and is generally what you want.

Install will install packages from a packages.config file. Use this option if you want to install a standalone tool package.

inputs.name: noCache
inputs.label: Disable local cache
inputs.helpMarkDown: Equivalent to the -NoCache NuGet.exe command line argument

inputs.name: packagesDirectory
inputs.label: Destination directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Equivalent to the -PackagesDirectory NuGet.exe command line argument

inputs.name: nuGetVersion
inputs.label: NuGet Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of NuGet to use, or external version.

inputs.name: nuGetPath
inputs.label: Path to NuGet.exe
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally supply the path to NuGet.exe. Will override version selection.
